title: Escalation Management
description: Monitor and manage task escalation rules, SLA compliance, and automated notifications to ensure critical GST deadlines are never missed and client expectations are consistently met.

buttons.name: Create Escalation Rule
buttons.purpose: Define new escalation triggers based on task age, priority, or client importance for proactive issue management
buttons.gstExample: Auto-escalate GST appeal filing tasks to partner level when 48 hours remain before 30-day statutory deadline

buttons.name: SLA Monitor
buttons.purpose: Track service level agreement compliance across all GST cases and identify potential deadline risks
buttons.gstExample: Monitor all GST assessment response tasks to ensure 30-day reply deadlines are met with 5-day early warning alerts

buttons.name: Escalation History
buttons.purpose: Review past escalations to identify patterns and improve workflow efficiency and deadline management
buttons.gstExample: Analyze GST hearing preparation escalations to identify bottlenecks in document compilation processes

buttons.name: Override Escalation
buttons.purpose: Manually escalate critical tasks or pause escalation rules when special circumstances require immediate attention
buttons.gstExample: Immediately escalate GST refund claim worth ₹50 lakhs to senior partner when government issues new policy clarification

buttons.name: Team Notification Settings
buttons.purpose: Configure escalation notification preferences for different team members based on expertise and availability
buttons.gstExample: Route GST audit notice escalations to tax specialists while sending hearing date conflicts to litigation team leads

philosophy: In GST litigation, escalation management is not just operational efficiency—it's professional survival. GST cases involve unforgiving statutory deadlines where missing a 30-day appeal window or 60-day response period can result in significant financial losses for clients and potential negligence claims against practitioners. Our escalation system ensures that no critical deadline slips through organizational cracks and that appropriate expertise is engaged before problems become crises.

examples.solution: Escalation rule triggers: (1) 7-day warning to case handler, (2) 3-day escalation to senior associate, (3) 1-day emergency alert to partner, (4) Same-day client notification of risk status, (5) Automatic calendar blocking for priority handling
examples.benefit: Zero missed appeal deadlines, clear accountability chain, client confidence, malpractice risk mitigation, systematic deadline protection

examples.solution: Value-based escalation: Claims above ₹25 lakhs auto-escalate after 48 hours of inactivity, trigger partner review, activate client communication protocol, engage additional resources for expedited processing
examples.benefit: Faster refund recovery, improved client satisfaction, competitive advantage, reduced opportunity cost for high-value matters

examples.solution: Workflow escalation: When hearing preparation tasks remain in 'document collection' stage for 3+ days, escalate to document team lead, notify case partner, trigger backup resource allocation, activate expedited review process
examples.benefit: Comprehensive hearing preparation, no last-minute scrambling, professional court appearance, improved case outcomes

examples.solution: Communication escalation: When client emails remain unanswered for 24 hours, escalate to relationship manager, trigger immediate response protocol, generate client communication summary, schedule follow-up call
examples.benefit: Maintained client relationships, professional service standards, reduced client churn, enhanced reputation management

examples.solution: Capacity escalation: When individual task loads exceed 85% capacity, trigger workload rebalancing, escalate to team lead for resource reallocation, activate backup team protocols, adjust new case intake
examples.benefit: Balanced team workload, maintained service quality, reduced burnout risk, sustainable practice growth, consistent performance

escalationLevels.action: Email notification to assigned team member and immediate supervisor
escalationLevels.gstExample: GST appeal draft completion reminder sent when 15 of 30 days have elapsed

escalationLevels.trigger: Task aging beyond 75% of deadline or high-priority task delay
escalationLevels.action: Supervisor notification with task summary and resource allocation options
escalationLevels.gstExample: Senior associate alerted when GST audit response has only 7 days remaining for completion

escalationLevels.trigger: Critical deadline risk or high-value case issues
escalationLevels.action: Partner notification with immediate action recommendations and client impact assessment
escalationLevels.gstExample: Partner alerted when ₹1 crore GST refund claim faces potential deadline miss with immediate intervention options

escalationLevels.trigger: Imminent deadline miss or critical client relationship risk
escalationLevels.action: All-hands escalation with immediate resource reallocation and crisis management protocols
escalationLevels.gstExample: Emergency response when GST appeal filing has less than 24 hours remaining with incomplete documentation

bestPractices.title: Proactive Escalation Rules
bestPractices.description: Set escalation triggers well before actual deadlines to allow adequate time for resolution
bestPractices.gstApplication: Escalate GST appeal tasks at 50%, 75%, and 90% of the 30-day deadline rather than waiting until the last moment

bestPractices.title: Value-Based Prioritization
bestPractices.description: Configure escalation rules to consider case value and client importance for appropriate resource allocation
bestPractices.gstApplication: High-value GST cases (₹50+ lakhs) receive faster escalation timelines and senior-level involvement from day one

bestPractices.title: Clear Escalation Ownership
bestPractices.description: Define clear responsibility chains so everyone knows who handles escalated tasks at each level
bestPractices.gstApplication: GST audit escalations go to tax specialists first, then litigation team, then partner—never ambiguous routing

bestPractices.title: Client Communication Integration
bestPractices.description: Include client notification protocols in escalation workflows to maintain transparency and trust
bestPractices.gstApplication: Automatically inform clients when GST case escalates to partner level, explaining enhanced attention and expected outcomes

bestPractices.title: Performance Analytics
bestPractices.description: Regularly review escalation patterns to identify systemic issues and improve baseline workflows
bestPractices.gstApplication: Monthly analysis of GST deadline escalations to identify process improvements and training needs

troubleshooting.solution: Adjust escalation thresholds and add buffer time for complex GST cases that naturally require more time
troubleshooting.gstContext: GST tribunal cases may need longer preparation times than assessment appeals—adjust rules accordingly

troubleshooting.solution: Review team structure mappings and update escalation routing based on current expertise and availability
troubleshooting.gstContext: Ensure GST indirect tax escalations reach customs experts when cases involve both GST and customs issues

troubleshooting.solution: Implement client notification protocols and explanation templates for escalation communications
troubleshooting.gstContext: Explain to GST clients that escalation means enhanced attention, not case problems—position it positively

troubleshooting.solution: Provide training on escalation benefits and implement recognition for proactive escalation management
troubleshooting.gstContext: Emphasize how GST escalation protocols protect both client interests and professional reputation

slaMetrics.description: Average time from escalation trigger to first response action
slaMetrics.gstTarget: Level 1: 2 hours, Level 2: 1 hour, Level 3: 30 minutes, Level 4: Immediate

slaMetrics.description: Percentage of tasks completed before statutory deadlines despite escalation
slaMetrics.gstTarget: 99.5% compliance rate for all GST statutory deadlines including appeals and responses

slaMetrics.description: Percentage of escalated tasks successfully resolved without deadline miss
slaMetrics.gstTarget: 95% of escalated GST tasks resolved successfully with client satisfaction maintained

slaMetrics.description: Client feedback scores for cases that underwent escalation protocols
slaMetrics.gstTarget: Maintain 4.5/5 client satisfaction rating even for escalated GST matters
